Intelligent Group Search

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51814].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Audit log doesn't provide information for created/deleted pages in Confluence, and the editing can be only viewed through Page History.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please, provide an option to enable the audit log for page changes.
h3. Why this is important

Some customers need more detailed information about the changes done in Confluence, and the audit log provides information only in a space level.
fields.summary: Detailed audit log for Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51812].
{panel}
*CURRENT BEHAVIOUR*
 Synchrony tables are append-only at this time. As the tables increase in size they may become too large for some databases which could cause performance issue while saving pages.

It would me convenience if we introduce a Scheduled job to empty Synchrony tables in Confluence in order to improve the performance.

*WORKAROUND*
 Truncate the Synchrony tables as discussed in the knowledge base article below:
 * [How to reduce the size of Synchrony tables|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-reduce-the-size-of-synchrony-tables-858770831.html]

{panel:title=Atlassian Update Sept 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Thank you for your votes and comments on this suggestion. They have been helpful in making the decision to prioritise this issue.

We are excited to announce that the capability to schedule jobs to empty out Synchrony tables was shipped in 7.0.1.

Cheers,

Confluence Product Management
{panel}
fields.summary: Introduce a Scheduled job to empty Synchrony tables in Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Username that contains macro will break People Directory

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new user in confluence that contains a macro. For example:
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Go to the People Directory

h3. Expected Results
# People directory is shown correctly
# Not able to save a user that contains macro
#* Provide a warning when user is created with curly brackets, '{'

h3. Actual Results
The following is displayed in the people directory:
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

It seems like the People Directory tries to render the macro

fields.summary: Cannot purge page

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Admin user is not able to see the preview of attachment if it is not directly in a group with view permissions on that page or space.
h3. Environment
 * Linux / Centos 7 64bit
 * Java 1.8.0_111

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create group and user without admin permissions.
 # Create a page with that user. And attach an attachment to it (not image).
 # Make sure that admin user does not have a direct view permission from the group or from space on that page.
 # Check with admin user that page.
 # The Attachment will be not shown.

h3. Expected Results

Admin user without direct view permissions on the page should have permissions to see attachment as it can see page and content.

!image-2017-03-10-18-09-01-091.png!
h3. Actual Results

Attachment preview can not be seen.

!view_with_admin.png!
h3.  
h3. Workaround

Add admin to the group that has view permissions on that page.
fields.summary: Admin unable to see preview of attachment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51792].
  {panel}

h2. Problem Definition
In case of Confluence Server synchrony is deployed on the same container as Confluence and it's starting together with Confluence and can be controlled from Confluence interface.
In case of Confluence Data Center the synchrony nodes can be deployed separately.

h5. Suggestion
Please provide the documentation on how to install synchrony as a service on Windows and Linux hosts.

h2. Solution
We now have an article on how to run Synchrony as a service on linux: [Run Synchrony-standalone as a service on linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/run-synchrony-standalone-as-a-service-on-linux-933081078.html]
fields.summary: Documentation for configuring Synchrony to run as a service in the DC

h3. Summary When you paste a link and then edit again, whole paragraphs are converted to links. h3. Environment Local instance, no proxy. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a page with headings and content. # Edit the page and type or paste a plain text web url immediately below a heading. # Press [enter] to generate a newline. The url will be converted to an anchor tag. Do not press backspace or delete the newline. # Update the page. The page will be saved with the url anchored, and without a newline # Edit the page again. All content after the anchor will be converted to anchors to the same location h3. Expected Results The link would be a link and the paragraphs would be plain text h3. fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51780].
  {panel}

h2. NOTE: You can now un-subscribe yourself from Atlassian Answers notifications.

Simply click the "Un-subscribe from all notifications" link that appears in the email footer of all emails that are now sent from Answers.
Some users may find that clicking the link results in a system error message - even though this happens, the unsubscribe request should still have been processed successfully.

-------

The old Atlassian Answers had a number of fine-grained notification options that allowed users to control which emails they received from the system.

Many users were able to completely de-activate any emails from being sent, even though technically they were probably subscribed to a bunch of questions or topics.

When we migrated Answers to Confluence Questions, these notification controls were lost, but each user's subscriptions were kept intact.  Now, many users have started receiving emails that they do not want to get.

We are planning to build a self-service unsubscribe option into Confluence Questions itself (see [CQ-1334]). However, this may take some time to implement, and many users want a solution immediately.

As an interim measure, let's create a process for Atlassian staff to manually un-subscribe users from all emails if they request it.
fields.summary: Un-subscribe users from all emails from Atlassian Answers if they have requested it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51721].
  {panel}

Let me give a rationale for making questions space specific by quoting Atlassian documentation:

1. "In Confluence, content is organised into spaces."

If you are not putting questions to spaces the consistency of the design is broken and this will not scale well to enterprise. Of course, as with other content in confluence you should be able to search globally or within the space.

2. "You can then browse all pages with that label in a single space or across the site, or display a list of pages with that label."

Labels (which approximately equal) topics should be there to provide an extra layer of organization on top of spaces.

Note, example even Calendars get a related space, even though the calendars are going to have much lower cardinality on average compared to questions (or even topics) and the need to classify and organize them would be lower.

In the end people will use topics/labels to represent the space association, but this is semantically not clean and consistent and that matters.
fields.summary: Allow questions to be associated with a space

Needed to support the ask questions from a Confluence space story:

h3. Story
* John is new at the company and is trying to find general information about benefits.
* He navigates to the HR space but doesn't see what he's looking for.
* He sees an "ask a question" button on the HR home page and clicks it.
* He's directed to CQ where he posts a question in the "HR" topic. (The HR topic is already selected for him)

h3. Features
* Macro would be called the "Ask Question" macro (similar to the [create page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Create+from+Template+Macro] macro)
* When configuring the macro, it would have params for:
** Button Text
** Topic(s)

Info on how you can use Confluence's Create from Template macro to make an Ask a Question button can be found here https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/QUESTIONS/Integrating+Questions+with+your+spaces
fields.summary: Ask a question macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-51711].
  {panel}

Answers are one of the channels where people can inquire about Atlassian products and issues they are facing.

Looking through some answers, I have noticed there are cases where people who raised the question are accepting their own answers even though the same have been answered by someone else previously.

Instead of giving Karma to those people I would suggest to take them away from the amount of Karma those people have considering the following scenarios:
* if there are no answers given, the owner to the question raised *can* accept its on answer but no Karma will be given.
** a warning message should be presented to the user prior accepting its own answer informing what is going to happen
* if there are answers already posted,  the owner to the question raised *cannot* accept its on answer and the Karma will be subtracted from its own in case the same accepts its own answer
** a warning message should be presented to the user prior accepting its own answer informing what is going to happen
** this is a way to enforce and acknowledge that people are spending time providing answers to the question raised.
fields.summary: Person who raised a question should not be able to accept its own answer

Related to TEAMCAL-1643, this issue is to track the ability to turn-off event types for a calendar. 

Existing behaviour: At the moment if you delete all events of a particular type, it still appears in the calendar event type list.

This issue is to track the removal of that. This would also include removing the actual events (if there are any), so we may need a confirmation prompt if there is events in that stream. A user can export them if they want a backup. 

Interested to hear customer comments on this ticket - why do they want to disable specific types of events? What would they disable now?
